lines.text: Welcome to Sort Resort! I'm Professor Whiskers.
I know - a talking cat. Long story. The short version: reality is broken and you're here to help fix it.
Match three identical items to clear them. Let's start simple!
Excellent instincts! You're getting the hang of this.
The puzzles get trickier from here. New containers, new surprises. Stay sharp!
Ten portals down! You're a natural at this.
I've been handling these alone for years. Having help is... nice.
These portals appeared after a lab accident years ago.
My owner, Dr. Miller, was working on dimensional gateways.
Something went wrong. She vanished. And I... changed.
Dr. Miller was brilliant. She wanted to solve big problems.
Waste management, resource distribution - using portals to move things between dimensions efficiently.
She'd hate seeing her work cause this much chaos.
I wasn't always this articulate, you know.
The accident did something to me. Enhanced cognition, speech...
A rather steep price for knocking over lab equipment.
Halfway through! There's something I need to tell you.
The accident... it wasn't random equipment failure.
I knocked over the dimensional calibrator. A cat wanting attention.
Dr. Miller tried to save me instead of herself. That's why I have to fix this.
Sometimes I detect faint energy signatures in these rifts.
Could be echoes. Could be something more.
I choose to believe Dr. Miller is out there somewhere.
You know, Dr. Miller had other animals in the lab too.
A raccoon, an alpaca, a pig, and a dog. All in the blast radius.
I wonder what happened to them...
The portals are getting more complex. That's actually a good sign.
It means we're approaching a dimensional nexus point.
Other worlds connect through these. Worlds that need our help too.
Almost there! I'm detecting portal signatures from other dimensions.
A supermarket, a farm... these rifts are everywhere.
Once we stabilize this island, we can start exploring.
One hundred portals! This island is dimensionally stable!
But I'm picking up distress signals from connected worlds.
One of them feels... familiar. Like something from the lab.
Pack your bags. The multiverse needs us!
Whoa whoa whoa. Who are you and why are you in my store?
...Whiskers sent you? That old furball is still alive?
Fine. Help me sort this mess and maybe I'll talk.
Yeah, I was in Dr. Miller's lab too. The raccoon in cage three.
Woke up here surrounded by groceries and dimensional junk.
So I did what any raccoon would do. I organized everything.
These shelves keep restocking with random stuff from other worlds.
Alien fruit, medieval cheese, space rations... it never stops.
But I gotta admit, the variety IS pretty great.
The transformation hit me different than Whiskers.
He got the big brain. I got... instincts. Amplified.
I can sense when something's out of place from three aisles away. Drives me crazy till it's sorted.
Whiskers thinks this is all about science. Typical cat.
But I've been watching these portals for years.
They're not random. Something is pulling them open.
Alright, I trust you enough to tell you something.
A few months back, I saw something come through a rift.
A glowing figure. Human-shaped. Moving with purpose.
Gone before I could get close. But it felt... familiar.
After that figure passed through, the portals here calmed down.
Just for a few hours. Like someone had tuned them.
Whoever - or whatever - that was, they knew what they were doing.
I found something in aisle seven after the figure left.
A scorch mark on the floor. Same pattern as Dr. Miller's lab equipment used to leave.
Coincidence? Maybe. But my gut says no.
You know what I miss most about the lab? Routine.
Dr. Miller fed us at the same time every day. Like clockwork.
That woman ran a tight ship. Wherever she is, I bet she's got a schedule pinned to the wall.
We're almost done here! My shelves haven't been this neat in years.
I'm picking up portal signatures leading somewhere rural.
Smells like hay and... alpaca? No way.
Store's sorted! I haven't felt this good since cage three!
Listen - that energy trail from the glowing figure? It leads to the next world. A farm.
If Mara's there... you tell her Tommy says hi. And that I'm still mad she ate my lettuce that one time.
Oh! A visitor! I'm sorry everything's such a mess!
I'm Mara. This was a lovely farm before the portals started mixing everything up.
Dimensional turnips in the wheat field, space rocks in the chicken coop... please, can you help?
Oh, that's so much better! Thank you!
Yes, I was in Dr. Miller's lab. The alpaca by the window.
I still have nightmares about that day. Everything just... tore apart.
I landed here and the farm sort of... grew around me.
The dimensional energy made everything fertile. Too fertile.
Things grow where they shouldn't. Crops from worlds I've never seen.
Tommy sent his regards? That grumpy raccoon!
We used to share a wall in the lab. He'd steal food through the bars.
I hope he's eating properly. Raccoons are terrible at nutrition.
I need to show you something. I found it in the north field.
A notebook. It drifted through a portal about a year ago.
It's Dr. Miller's handwriting. I'd recognize it anywhere.
The notebook has partial equations. I can't understand the math.
But the notes in the margins are clear enough.
She wrote: "Closing rifts may trigger cascade resonance. Each repair stresses adjacent dimensions."
She's alive. And she's worried about what we're doing.
There's more in the notebook. She wrote about us.
"If my animals survived, they'll try to help. They always did."
She knew we'd come looking for her.
But she also wrote "Don't rush. The multiverse is fragile."
The last entry in the notebook is just coordinates.
Not for here. Not for the island or supermarket either.
Somewhere else entirely. And a note: "Find Mason. He'll know."
Mason? That was the pig from the lab!
The farm is really coming together! Look at those fields!
But I've noticed the portals are changing. Getting... organized.
Almost like something is guiding them into patterns.
I can feel new portal signatures forming.
One of them smells like old wood and spilled ale.
A tavern! Mason always did love the kitchen at the lab.
Be careful. The portals ahead feel stronger than anything we've seen.
The farm is saved! Thank you, truly.
Take the notebook. You'll need it more than me.
And please... find Dr. Miller. Tell her we're okay.
Tell her the alpaca by the window still misses her.
Another portal traveler. Take a seat.
Name's Mason. I run this place.
You want to sort my tavern? Fine. But don't touch my personal collection behind the bar.
So Whiskers is running an operation now? Good for him.
I always figured that cat would land on his feet. Literally.
Yeah, I was one of Miller's lab animals. The handsome one.
This tavern sits at a crossroads between dimensions.
Travelers come through all the time. Swap stories, trade goods.
I hear things. Rumors from worlds you can't imagine.
Mara's notebook, eh? Let me see those coordinates.
...Interesting. These point toward the dimensional deep.
Only someone who really understood portal physics could navigate there.
I've heard whispers from travelers. About a "ghost woman."
Shows up in different worlds, adjusts the portals, disappears.
They say she leaves things more organized than she found them. Sound like anyone we know?
Alright. Cards on the table.
About six months ago, a woman walked into my tavern.
Human. Lab coat. Tired eyes. Asked for water and a quiet corner.
I knew who she was the moment I smelled her. You never forget the person who fed you every day for three years.
She recognized me too. Cried a bit. Hugged my big stupid head.
Said she's been moving between dimensions, trying to build something. A stabilizer.
Said she's "almost there" but needs the background chaos cleared first. That's us. We're clearing the background chaos.
She told me something else. About why the portals keep forming.
It's not just entropy. The original accident created a feedback loop.
Every portal that opens makes the next one easier to form.
Unless someone stabilizes them from both sides. Her from the deep, us from out here.
Miller said there's one more of us out there. Leika.
The dog ended up on a space station near the nexus point.
If anyone can find Miller's exact location, it's her.
That dog always could track a scent across a room. Imagine what she can do across dimensions.
She left me something before she went. A small device.
Said to give it to whoever came looking for her.
It's a beacon. Should help Leika lock onto her signal.
Take it. Go find our girl.
Tavern's shipshape. First time in years.
Listen. When you find Miller... tell her Mason's doing alright.
Tell her the pig learned to cook.
And tell her she still owes me for that water. Now get going. The stars are waiting.
A PERSON! An actual person! Up here! In SPACE!
I'm Leika! I've been monitoring dimensional frequencies for years! Alone! In space! It's been a LOT!
Whiskers sent you?! Tommy! Mara! Mason! They're all okay?!
Sorry, I get excited. It's been quiet up here.
I was Dr. Miller's dog. Lab security, she called me.
Mostly I just followed her everywhere and barked at the equipment.
The space station was already here when I arrived.
Some kind of automated research outpost. I figured out the controls eventually.
Turns out being hyper-intelligent AND a good girl is a winning combination!
From up here, I can see the whole dimensional web.
It's beautiful. And broken. Threads fraying everywhere.
But since you started sorting... some threads are reconnecting.
You have Mason's beacon?! Let me plug that in!
...Processing... triangulating...
I'm getting a signal! Faint, but it's definitely her frequency!
The signal is coming from the convergence point.
It's where all dimensional threads meet. The center of everything.
Dr. Miller has been there this whole time. Building something massive.
A dimensional stabilizer. One big enough to fix everything.
I can see her work from here. She's been closing micro-rifts around the convergence point, one by one.
We've been working the same problem from opposite ends!
Her from the center out, us from the edges in.
The stabilizer is almost complete. But she needs the outer dimensions clear first.
If she activates it while there's still too much chaos... the feedback loop could overload everything.
We're not just sorting for fun. We're clearing the path for her.
I sent her a message through the dimensional frequencies!
And she responded! Just two words: "Good girl."
...I'm not crying. Dogs don't cry. It's space allergies.
Almost there! The dimensional web is stabilizing beautifully.
I can see the convergence point getting brighter!
When you finish here, the path to Dr. Miller should be clear.
We're going to find her. We're really going to find her!
Station sorted! Dimensions stabilizing! Signal locked!
I can see her! On my instruments - Dr. Miller, alive and working!
The path to the convergence point is open. But it won't be easy. New worlds, new challenges.
She's waiting for us. All of us. Her whole little family.
This isn't the end. It's the beginning of bringing her home!
Welcome! You're in Free Play mode - no move limits, no timers. Just relax and sort at your own pace!
When you're ready for a challenge, try the other modes! Star Mode tracks your moves, Timer Mode races the clock, and Hard Mode... well, that's for the brave.
Star Mode! Now we're tracking your moves.
Use as few moves as possible to earn up to 3 stars!
Timer Mode! The clock is ticking!
Sort everything before time runs out. No pressure!
...Okay, maybe a little pressure.
Hard Mode?! Stars AND a timer?
You've earned this by mastering both Star and Timer modes.
Show these portals who's boss!
Incredible! You've mastered both Star and Timer modes!
Hard Mode is now unlocked for the island.
Stars AND a timer. The ultimate challenge awaits!
No way! You cleaned out Star AND Timer for my store?
Hard Mode unlocked. Good luck keeping up!
Oh my! You've completed both Star and Timer modes!
Hard Mode is unlocked. I believe in you!
Well well. Star Mode AND Timer Mode, done and dusted.
Hard Mode's open. This one's not for the faint of heart.
You did BOTH Star AND Timer?! All 100 levels?!
Hard Mode activated! Maximum challenge! Let's GOOO!
